Class ScannerManager

java.lang.Object
org.javaLab5.inputManager.ScannerManager
public class ScannerManager extends Object
The ScannerManager class manages the Scanner instances used for reading input from various sources. It provides functionality to switch between reading from the console and reading from a file. The class also allows saving and restoring the current Scanner state.

The class utilizes Getter and Setter annotations for the fileScanner property to automatically generate getter and setter methods.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScannerManager

      public ScannerManager()

  • Method Details

    • setConsoleScanner

      public static void setConsoleScanner()
      Sets the Scanner to the console scanner, switching input source to the console.

    • setMainFileScanner

      public static void setMainFileScanner()
      Sets the Scanner to the file scanner, switching input source to a file.

    • saveScanner

      public static void saveScanner()
      Saves the current Scanner instance to the temporary scanner. This method allows restoring the previous Scanner state later.

    • loadScanner

      public static void loadScanner()
      Restores the Scanner to the previous state saved by saveScanner().

    • closeFileScanner

      public static void closeFileScanner()
      Closes the file Scanner if it is not null. This method should be called when done reading from a file to release the resource.

    • readLine

      public static String readLine()
      Reads a line of input from the current Scanner.

      If the current Scanner is null or has no next line, it switches to the console scanner.

      Returns:
      The line of input read from the current Scanner.

    • hasNextLine

      public static boolean hasNextLine()
      Checks if there is a next line of input available from the current Scanner.

      If the current Scanner is null or has no next line, it switches to the console scanner.

      Returns:
      true if there is another line of input available, false otherwise.
